{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|chrono}}
{{dcl|since=c++20|num=1|
constexpr std::chrono::day operator+( const std::chrono::day&amp;  d,
                                      const std::chrono::days&amp; ds ) noexcept;
}}
{{dcl|since=c++20|num=2|
constexpr std::chrono::day operator+( const std::chrono::days&amp; ds,
                                      const std::chrono::day&amp;  d ) noexcept;
}}
{{dcl|since=c++20|num=3|
constexpr std::chrono::day operator-( const std::chrono::day&amp;  d,
                                      const std::chrono::days&amp; ds ) noexcept;
}}
{{dcl|since=c++20|num=4|
constexpr std::chrono::days operator-( const std::chrono::day&amp; x,
                                       const std::chrono::day&amp; y ) noexcept;
}}
{{dcl end}}

@1,2@ Adds {{c|ds.count()}} days to {{c|d}}.
@3@ Subtracts {{c|ds.count()}} days from {{c|d}}.
@4@ Calculate the difference, in days, between two {{c|day}} {{c|x}} and {{c|y}}.

===Return value===
@1,2@ {{c|std::chrono::day(unsigned(d) + ds.count())}}
@3@ {{c|std::chrono::day(unsigned(d) - ds.count())}}
@4@ {{c|std::chrono::days(int(unsigned(x)) - int(unsigned(y)))}}

===Notes===
@1-3@ If the result would be outside the range {{closed range|0|255}}, the actual stored value is unspecified.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cassert&gt;
#include &lt;chrono&gt;

int main()
{
    std::chrono::day d{15};

    d = d + std::chrono::days(2);
    assert(d == std::chrono::day(17));

    d = d - std::chrono::days(3);
    assert(d == std::chrono::day(14));

    constexpr std::chrono::days ds = std::chrono::day(16) - std::chrono::day(14);
    static_assert(ds == std::chrono::days(2));
}
}}
